newsitem.title: USA: Gore beat Kemp in debate, three polls say.
newsitem.headline: Gore beat Kemp in debate, three polls say.

text.p: Vice President Al Gore did a better job than Republican Jack Kemp in the second debate of the presidential campaign, according to post-debate polls.

In a CBS News poll taken after the Wednesday night debate, 48 percent said Gore did a better job, while 31 percent favoured Republican vice presidential nominee Kemp. Thirteen percent said they tied and 8 percent had no opinion.
The poll sampled 348 registered voters and had a margin of error of plus or minus six percentage points.

A CNN/USA Today/Gallup poll of 408 registered voters who watched the debate showed 57 percent thought Gore did a better job while 28 percent favoured Kemp. Thirteen percent saw the debate as a tie. This poll had a margin of error of plus or minus 5 percentage points.

In a third poll, ABC News found Gore won by a margin of 50 percent to 27 percent. Another 21 percent called it a tie. The poll of 534 registered voters had a margin of error of plus or minus five percentage points.
